Charizard.overview: The tier is still in its infancy and the metagame develops with each passing day. The sample set(s) provided below will be regularly updated until proper analyses are in the works. See it as a rough outline to get started and accustomed to what sets are commonly used.

Ditto.overview: The tier is still in its infancy and the metagame develops with each passing day. The sample set(s) provided below will be regularly updated until proper analyses are in the works. See it as a rough outline to get started and accustomed to what sets are commonly used.

sets.name: Imposter
sets.description: Tera Steel makes Ditto immune to Toxic Spikes and take less from Stealth Rock. It also lets Ditto revenge kill Belly Drum Hariyama. A Quiet nature and the Special Attack investment is in case Ditto transforms into a Future Sight user like Slowbro.

Hariyama.overview: The tier is still in its infancy and the metagame develops with each passing day. The sample set(s) provided below will be regularly updated until proper analyses are in the works. See it as a rough outline to get started and accustomed to what sets are commonly used.

sets.name: Assault Vest
sets.description: The EV spread is to avoid the 2HKO from Choice Band Weavile and the OHKO from +2 Salazzle after Stealth Rock and 3 layers of Spikes.

sets.name: Belly Drum
sets.description: The Special Defense EVs ensures Tera Steel Hariyama avoids the KO from Rotom-H's Overheat after using Belly Drum and 1 layer of Spikes. The Defense EVs are to live Primeape's Drain Punch after Hariyama has used Belly Drum.

sets.name: Flame Orb
sets.description: The EV spread is to outspeed defensive Pokemon such as Alomomola and survive a +2 Flamethrower from Salazzle after burn damage.

sets.name: Defog
sets.description: The EV spread is to avoid the 2HKO from unboosted Flamigo's Brave Bird.

sets.name: Rapid Spin
sets.description: 24 Speed EVs are to outrun Modest Toxtricity after a Rapid Spin, Mismagius and Cryogonal at +2, and Choice Scarf Passimian at +3 Speed.

Revavroom.overview: The tier is still in its infancy and the metagame develops with each passing day. The sample set(s) provided below will be regularly updated until proper analyses are in the works. See it as a rough outline to get started and accustomed to what sets are commonly used.

sets.name: Specially Defensive
sets.description: Overcoat is an option over Filter so Venomoth can't try to muscle past a weakened Revavroom with Sleep Powder and enough sleep turns.

sets.name: Shift Gear
sets.description: Tera Ground covers Steel- and Fire-types such as Klefki, Coalossal, and Paldean Tauros-F, but Tera Fire can be used for Bronzong.

Cetitan.overview: The tier is still in its infancy and the metagame develops with each passing day. The sample set(s) provided below will be regularly updated until proper analyses are in the works. See it as a rough outline to get started and accustomed to what sets are commonly used.

sets.name: Slush Rush Sweeper
sets.description: The Speed EVs are to outrun +2 neutral natured Toxtricity. With 60 Defense EVs, Cetitan under snow survives Paldean Tauros-F's Close Combat even after Belly Drum.

Tatsugiri.overview: The tier is still in its infancy and the metagame develops with each passing day. The sample set(s) provided below will be regularly updated until proper analyses are in the works. See it as a rough outline to get started and accustomed to what sets are commonly used.

sets.name: Offensive Spinner
sets.description: Despite having no effect in singles, Commander is used so Gardevoir can't Trace Storm Drain and wall Tatsugiri. Tera Steel turns the tide on Fairy-types such as Gardevoir and Sylveon. It also helps against Cryogonal's Freeze Dry.
